comments: Matches the terms with g.f. ( 3-2*x-2*x^2 ) / ( 1-5*x+2*x^2+3*x^3 ) for n<=9. - _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 11 2016
references: D. W. Boyd, Some integer sequences related to the Pisot sequences, Acta Arithmetica, 34 (1979), 295-305.
links: D. W. Boyd, Linear recurrence relations for some generalized Pisot sequences, Advances in Number Theory ( Kingston ON, 1991) 333-340, Oxford Sci. Publ., Oxford Univ. Press, New York, 1993.
maple: A010921 := proc(n)    option remember;    if n <= 1 then        op(n+1,[3,13]) ;    else        a := procname(n-1)^2/procname(n-2) ;        floor(1+a) ;    end if;end proc: # _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 11 2016
prog: (PARI) A010921(n,a=[3,13])={for(n=2,if(type(n)=="t_VEC",n[1],n),a=concat(a,a[n]^2\a[n-1]+1));if(type(n)=="t_VEC",a,a[n+1])} \\ Use A010921([n]) to get the vector [a(0),...,a(n)]. - _M. F. Hasler_, Feb 11 2016
author: _Simon Plouffe_
